availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Frankfort, Franklin County, Kentucky, attorney. Kentucky native. Son of Prudence Hensley. Resident of Franklin County in 1850. Household owned two enslaved persons in Franklin County in 1850. Lawyer in Franklin County, Kentucky in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, District 2, pp. 52B-53A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, District 2.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, Frankfort, p. 245.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, Frankfort, p. 116B.
"Alfred Hensley (1831-1871)," Find A Grave, Memorial 136511293, accessed August 13, 2022, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/136511293.
